div.p: SODA, the name given by the French chemiſts to the mineral alkali, which is found native in many parts of the world : it is obtained alſo from common ſalt, and from the aſhes of the kali, a ſpecies of ſalſola. See Alkali, n⁰ 7. and Chemistry-Index.
Soda is alſo a name for a heat in the ſtomach or heart-burn. See Medicine, n⁰ 275.
